definitions: small loose grains of disintegrated rock covering beaches and deserts
areas characterized by extensive deposits of sand like beaches or deserts
examples: Children love playing with sand at the beach
The hourglass measures time through falling sand grains
The camel crossed miles of burning sand without water
Desert sand stretches endlessly toward the distant horizon

definitions: classical liturgical language of Hinduism and literary language of ancient India
examples: Sanskrit texts preserve ancient Hindu philosophical teachings
Students study Sanskrit to read original Buddhist scriptures

definitions: legendary figure who brings gifts to children at Christmas time
examples: Children eagerly await Santa's arrival on Christmas Eve
The mall Santa listened patiently to every child's wishlist

definitions: large hairy humanoid creature believed to inhabit forests of North America
examples: Believers claim sasquatch sightings throughout Pacific Northwest forests
The documentary explored evidence for sasquatch's possible existence

definitions: standardized test widely used for college admissions in the United States
examples: Students spend months preparing for their SAT examination
Her high SAT scores earned multiple university scholarship offers

definitions: supreme evil spirit and adversary of God in Abrahamic religions
examples: Medieval art often depicted Satan with horns and hooves
The sermon warned against Satan's temptations and deceptions

definitions: religious or philosophical belief system centered on Satan or opposing traditional religious values
examples: The documentary examined modern Satanism's actual beliefs and practices
Media portrayals of Satanism often misrepresent its philosophical foundations

definitions: day of the week between Friday and Sunday traditionally associated with rest
examples: Saturday morning cartoons were childhood weekend highlights
The farmers' market operates every Saturday throughout summer months

definitions: sixth planet from the sun known for its prominent ring system
ancient Roman god of agriculture and time equivalent to Greek Cronus
examples: Saturn's rings consist of countless ice and rock particles
The Cassini spacecraft spent years studying Saturn's moons
Ancient Romans honored Saturn during December Saturnalia festivals
Saturn devoured his children according to classical mythology

definitions: person from Saudi Arabia or relating to that country
examples: The Saudi delegation attended the international energy conference
Saudi culture blends ancient traditions with modern developments

definitions: tropical grassland with scattered trees found in Africa and other regions
historic port city in Georgia known for its preserved architecture
examples: Lions hunt zebras across the African savannah grasslands
The savannah ecosystem supports diverse wildlife populations
Savannah's historic district attracts millions of tourists annually
We toured Savannah's famous antebellum mansions last spring

definitions: person who saves someone or something from danger or difficulty
examples: The firefighter became the family's savior during the blaze
Christians believe Jesus Christ is humanity's spiritual savior

definitions: person who saves someone or something from danger or difficulty
examples: The doctor was hailed as the village's saviour during the epidemic
Many religions promise a saviour who will deliver believers

definitions: shortened form of saxophone used in informal musical contexts
examples: The jazz musician's sax solo brought the audience to their feet
She plays tenor sax in the school marching band

definitions: member of Germanic peoples who invaded Britain in fifth and sixth centuries
relating to the Saxons or their language culture and historical period
examples: The Saxons established kingdoms throughout southern England
Saxon warriors fought against Viking invasions for centuries
The church displays beautiful Saxon architectural features
Saxon poetry provides insights into early English culture

definitions: region in Northern Europe comprising Norway Sweden and Denmark sometimes including Finland and Iceland
examples: Scandinavia offers spectacular fjords and midnight sun experiences
Viking culture originated in Scandinavia over thousand years ago

definitions: person from or relating to Scandinavia its peoples languages or cultures
examples: Scandinavian design emphasizes simplicity and natural materials
The Scandinavian languages share many common linguistic features

definitions: medieval philosophy combining Aristotelian logic with Christian theology
relating to schools scholarship or educational institutions and methods
examples: Scholastic philosophers debated theological questions using logical reasoning
Thomas Aquinas represents the height of scholastic achievement
The scholastic publishing company produces educational materials nationwide
Her scholastic achievements earned multiple academic honors

definitions: religious movement founded by L Ron Hubbard based on self-improvement teachings
examples: Scientology centers offer personality tests and introductory courses
Celebrity involvement brought significant media attention to Scientology

definitions: eighth astrological sign associated with people born October 23 to November 21
constellation in southern sky resembling a scorpion
examples: Scorpio personalities are described as passionate and determined
Her Scorpio traits include intensity and mysterious magnetism
The constellation Scorpio contains the bright star Antares
Ancient astronomers identified Scorpio among the zodiac constellations

definitions: predatory arachnid with pincers and venomous stinger on curved tail
examples: The desert scorpion glows under ultraviolet light exposure
Scorpion stings require immediate medical attention in severe cases

definitions: native or inhabitant of Scotland or person of Scottish descent
examples: The proud Scot wore traditional Highland dress to the ceremony
Many Scots emigrated to North America during the clearances

definitions: whisky distilled in Scotland from malted barley
relating to Scotland or its people though Scots is preferred
examples: The connoisseur savored the aged single malt Scotch slowly
Scotch whisky exports contribute billions to Scotland's economy
Scotch mist creates mystical Highland landscape atmospheres
The Scotch dialect preserves many ancient word forms

definitions: country forming northern part of Great Britain with distinct culture and history
examples: Scotland voted to remain in the United Kingdom during 2014
The Scottish Highlands offer breathtaking scenery and ancient castles

definitions: man who is native to or inhabitant of Scotland
examples: The Scotsman newspaper covers Scottish news and politics daily
The young Scotsman competed in traditional Highland games events

definitions: Scottish terrier dog breed known for distinctive beard and eyebrows
examples: The black Scottie terrier won best in show award
President Roosevelt's Scottie Fala became America's most famous dog

definitions: of or relating to Scotland its people culture or languages
examples: Scottish independence remains a significant political issue today
The Scottish accent varies considerably between different regions

definitions: person sent ahead to gather information about enemy positions or terrain
member of Scout organization teaching outdoor skills and citizenship
examples: The military scout reported enemy troop movements ahead
Baseball scouts search nationwide for talented young players
The Boy Scout earned merit badges for camping and first aid
Girl Scouts sell cookies annually to fund their activities

definitions: popular board game where players form words from letter tiles for points
examples: Tournament Scrabble players memorize thousands of obscure words
Family Scrabble games often lead to dictionary disputes

definitions: person who copies documents especially before printing was invented
professional or public writer in ancient civilizations
examples: Medieval scribes laboriously copied manuscripts by hand
Monastery scribes preserved classical texts through dark ages
Egyptian scribes recorded pharaohs' decrees on papyrus scrolls
The scribe documented court proceedings in careful detail

definitions: sacred writings of a religion especially the Bible in Christian contexts
examples: The minister quoted scripture to support his sermon points
Different religions regard different texts as authoritative scripture

definitions: artist who creates three-dimensional artworks by carving modeling or assembling materials
examples: The sculptor chiseled marble into lifelike human forms
Modern sculptors work with diverse materials beyond traditional stone

definitions: person who works aboard ships especially as member of crew
examples: The experienced seaman navigated through treacherous storm waters
Merchant seamen transport goods across international shipping routes

definitions: scene of noisy confusion with many people talking simultaneously
biblical tower whose builders' languages were confused by God
examples: The crowded marketplace became a babel of competing voices
The meeting descended into babel with everyone arguing simultaneously
The Tower of Babel story explains linguistic diversity biblically
Babel represents human ambition challenging divine authority

definitions: ancient Mesopotamian city capital of Babylonian empire
place characterized by luxury decadence and moral corruption
examples: Babylon's hanging gardens ranked among ancient world wonders
Archaeologists continue excavating ancient Babylon's ruins in Iraq
Hollywood became the new Babylon of entertainment excess
The novel portrayed the city as modern Babylon

definitions: inhabitant of ancient Babylon or relating to Babylonian civilization and culture
examples: Babylonian astronomers created sophisticated mathematical models
The Babylonian captivity profoundly influenced Jewish religious thought

definitions: salt-cured pork typically from back or belly served in thin slices
examples: Crispy bacon accompanied the traditional breakfast plate perfectly
The restaurant offers maple-glazed bacon as a gourmet appetizer

definitions: stocky omnivorous mammal with distinctive black and white striped face
act of persistently harassing or pestering someone
examples: The badger dug extensive tunnel systems beneath the meadow
European badgers live in social groups called clans
Stop trying to badger me into changing my decision
Reporters continued to badger the politician for answers

definitions: state of equal distribution of weight or forces maintaining stability
instrument for weighing objects by comparing masses
amount of money remaining in an account or still owed
examples: The gymnast maintained perfect balance on the narrow beam
Work-life balance improves overall happiness and productivity
The laboratory balance measures substances to precise milligrams
Ancient merchants used balance scales for fair trading
Your account balance shows five hundred dollars remaining
Please pay the outstanding balance by month's end

definitions: large bundle of material compressed and bound for storage or transport
examples: The farmer stacked hay bales in the barn for winter
Cotton bales awaited shipment at the warehouse dock

definitions: relating to the Balkan Peninsula or its countries peoples and cultures
examples: Balkan cuisine combines Mediterranean and Ottoman influences beautifully
The Balkan conflicts of the 1990s reshaped regional boundaries

definitions: round object used in games and sports
formal social gathering for dancing
highly enjoyable experience or time
examples: The tennis ball sailed over the net for a winner
Children kicked the soccer ball around the playground
The debutante ball featured elegant gowns and orchestral music
They met at the charity ball last December
We had a ball at the amusement park yesterday
The kids are having a ball playing in the snow

definitions: relating to the Baltic Sea or countries bordering it
examples: Baltic amber contains prehistoric insects preserved perfectly
The Baltic states regained independence after Soviet collapse

definitions: large group of African languages and peoples of central and southern Africa
examples: Bantu languages share common grammatical structures and vocabulary
The Bantu expansion shaped sub-Saharan Africa's demographic landscape

definitions: member of Protestant Christian denomination emphasizing baptism by immersion
examples: The Baptist church practices full immersion baptism for believers
Southern Baptist conventions address contemporary theological issues

definitions: person who cuts and styles hair especially men's hair and shaves beards
examples: The barber skillfully shaped his beard with precision clippers
Old-fashioned barber shops offer traditional straight razor shaves

definitions: highly ornate European artistic and architectural style from 1600 to 1750
examples: Baroque churches feature dramatic lighting and elaborate decorations
Bach composed magnificent baroque fugues and cantatas

definitions: bottom or foundation on which something rests or is supported
military installation serving as headquarters or supply center
chemical compound that accepts protons or donates electrons
number used as foundation in mathematical counting system
examples: The statue stands on a marble base for stability
The mountain's base camp serves climbers before ascent
The army base houses thousands of military personnel
Naval base operations coordinate fleet movements worldwide
This base neutralizes acids to form salts and water
Strong bases have pH values above seven
Binary uses base two while decimal uses base ten
Converting between number bases requires systematic calculation

definitions: aromatic herb used in cooking especially Italian and Thai cuisine
male given name of Greek origin meaning royal
examples: Fresh basil transforms simple tomato sauce into gourmet pasta
Thai basil adds distinctive flavor to Southeast Asian dishes
Saint Basil founded important monastic communities in Cappadocia
Basil Rathbone portrayed Sherlock Holmes in classic films

definitions: member of people living in Basque regions of Spain and France
examples: Basque language predates all other European languages historically
The Basque people maintain strong cultural traditions and identity
